title: Prescribing Large Language Models for Perioperative Care: What's The Right Dose for Pre-trained Models?
abstract: arXiv:2402.17493v1 Announce Type: new  Abstract: Postoperative risk predictions can inform effective perioperative care management and planning. We aimed to assess whether clinical large language models (LLMs) can predict postoperative risks using clinical texts with various training strategies. The main cohort involved 84,875 records from Barnes Jewish Hospital (BJH) system between 2018 and 2021. Methods were replicated on Beth Israel Deaconess's MIMIC dataset. Both studies had mean duration of follow-up based on the length of postoperative ICU stay less than 7 days. For the BJH dataset, outcomes included 30-day mortality, pulmonary embolism (PE) and pneumonia. translated_title: 为围手术期护理开具大型语言模型：预训练模型的正确剂量是多少？
translated_abstract: 术后风险预测可以指导有效的围手术期护理管理和规划。我们旨在评估临床大型语言模型(LLMs)是否可以使用不同的训练策略预测术后风险。研究主要涉及2018年至2021年间来自Barnes Jewish医院系统的84,875份记录。方法在Beth Israel Deaconess的MIMIC数据集上进行了复制。两项研究的平均随访时间基于术后ICU住院时间小于7天。对于BJH数据集，结果包括30天死亡率、肺栓塞（PE）和肺炎。对BioGPT、ClinicalBERT和BioClinicalBERT实施了三种域自适应和微调策略：自监督目标；结合半监督微调的标签；以及通过多任务学习进行基础建模。模型性能使用接收器操作特征下的面积进行了比较。
tldr: 通过评估临床大型语言模型在术后风险预测中的应用，研究探讨了使用不同训练策略的模型在围手术期护理中的潜在效果。
en_tdlr: This study explores the potential effectiveness of clinical large language models in perioperative care by evaluating their application in postoperative risk prediction with various training strategies.
